Based on the user's preferences, I would recommend "The Kid" by Lily Tomlin and Daniel von Bargen.

The movie is about a mother who abandons her baby boy. An unsuspecting tramp finds the child and cares for him. A father' s love drives him to protect the kid.

Lily Tomlin, the lead actress in this movie, won an Academy Award for Best Actress for her role in "The Help" by Tate Taylor. Daniel von Bargen is also a talented actor who has appeared in various films including "Amarcord" by Léonide Pisetti and "The English Patient" by James Cameron.

Overall, "The Kid" is a heartwarming film that showcases the power of love and family. I hope you enjoy watching it!

I would recommend "Armageddon" as a thrilling and action-packed movie that you might enjoy.

"Armageddon" is a 1998 American disaster film directed by Roland Emmerich, based on the 1970 novel "Armageddon" by Michael Crichton. 

The movie tells the story of three groups: (1) The United States Air Force (USAF), led by General David Stubblebug, and including thousands of other personnel, as well as a large number of military vehicles; (2) A team of scientists and engineers from different companies, including Halliburton, Inc.  ("Halliburton"), which have developed a variety of advanced technologies for use in oil fields and similar environments; (3) A team of military police led by Captain "Jack" Bauer, who are responsible for maintaining order and enforcing laws within military bases. 

As the United States Air Force begins its massive deployment to prepare for an attack that is predicted to be devastating in scope and impact.
